original_title: Sri Lanka stocks close up, ASPI continues to climb
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Colombo Stock Exchange closed up on Monday, data on its site showed.
The broader ASPI climbed further to close up 0.77 percent, or 105.38 points, at 13,718; while the more liquid S&P SL20 Index closed up 0.71 percent, or 28.87 points, at 4,090.
Turnover was 4.4 billion. Major contributing sectors were diversified financials sectors (Rs953mn), capital goods (Rs905mn) and food beverage and tobacco (Rs781mn).
Large volumes were traded in Asia Asset Finance (up at 21.00), Ambeon Capital (up at 22.90), and John Keells Hotels (up at 20.80).
Top positive contributors to the ASPI were Hayleys (up at 116.00), LOLC Holdings (up at 476.75), Hatton National Bank (up at 242.00), Central Finance (up at 139.75), and Lanka IOC (up at 116.75).
Top turnover generators were Hayleys, Asia Asset Finance, Ambeon Capital, JKH, and Beruwala Resorts (up at 4.00).

Crossings were reported on Asia Asset Finance, Ambeon Capital, JKH, Associated Motor Finance Company (up at 30.60), Hemas Holdings (up at 91.10), Beruwala Resorts, Sunshine Holdings (up at 81.50), and Sampath Bank (down at 100.75). (Colombo/Dec9/2024)
